intro: Phyllanthus petchikaraensis, commonly known as the Petchikara starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
